uk.co.xfactorylibrarians.coremidi4j

Class Loader

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.xfactorylibrarians.coremidi4j.Loader

  • public class Loader
extends Object
    Loads the native library when we are running on a Mac. If necessary, extracts a copy of the library from our jar file to a temporary directory, to save the user the trouble of having to install it on their system. Arranges for that directory to be deleted when we exit.

    Inspired by the techniques used by usb4java, and the loader written by Klaus Raimer, k@ailis.de . See http://usb4java.org for the web site for the project and https://github.com/usb4java/usb4java for the GitHub repository.

    Author:
    James Elliott

    • Method Detail

      • isMacOSX

        private static boolean isMacOSX()
        Check that we are running on Mac OS X.
        Returns:
        true if the OS is OS X, otherwise false

      • createTempDirectory

        private static File createTempDirectory()
                                 throws CoreMidiException
        Creates the temporary directory used for unpacking the native library. This directory is marked to be deleted when the JVM exits.

        This requires review. There is a method java.nio.file.Files.createTempDirectory that creates a temporary directory. However, java.io.File.createTempFile(String,String) creates a file in the default temp directory.

        This method creates a temporary directory named coreMidi4J in the default temp directory. Other code then places the dynamically linked library in the coreMidi4J directory. Both the dynamically linked library file and the directory use File.deleteOnExit(). This should work since they will be deleted in reverse order. However, unexpected crashes could leave the system in a bad state where some files are not deleted.

        Returns:
        The temporary directory for the native library.
        Throws:
        CoreMidiException - if there is a problem communicating with CoreMIDI
        See Also:
        File.delete(), File.deleteOnExit()

      • copy

        private static void copy(InputStream input,
                         File output)
                  throws IOException
        Copies the specified input stream to the specified output file.
        Parameters:
        input - The input stream to be copied.
        output - The output file to which the stream should be copied.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the copy failed.

      • locateLibrary

        private static String locateLibrary()
                             throws CoreMidiException
        Locates the native library, extracting a temporary copy from our jar it does not already exist in the file system.
        Returns:
        The absolute path to the existing or extracted library.
        Throws:
        CoreMidiException - if there is a problem finding the library

      • load

        public static void load()
                 throws CoreMidiException
        Tries to load our native library. Can be safely called multiple times; duplicate attempts are ignored. This method is automatically called whenever any CoreMidi4J class that relies on JNI is loaded. If you need to do it earlier (to catch exceptions for example, or check whether the native library can be used), simply call this method manually.
        Throws:
        CoreMidiException - if something unexpected happens trying to load the native library on a Mac OS X system.

      • isAvailable

        public static boolean isAvailable()
                           throws CoreMidiException
        Checks whether CoreMidi4J is available on the current system, in other words whether it is a Mac OS X system and the native library was loaded successfully. Will attempt to perform that load if it has not yet occurred.
        Returns:
        true if this is a Mac OS X system and the native library has been loaded successfully.
        Throws:
        CoreMidiException - if something unexpected happens trying to load the native library on a Mac OS X system.
